  18! ObsSpaceData_mod:  the module, ObsSpaceData_mod, follows IndexListDepot_mod
  19
  20
  21module IndexListDepot_mod
  22  ! MODULE indexListDepot_mod (prefix='ild' category='7. Low-level data objects and utilities')
  23  !
  24  !:Purpose: The raison d'etre of this module is to support ObsSpaceData_mod in
  25  !           facilitating the traversal of a selection of the rows in its table.
  26  !           The selection of rows could be from either the header table or the
  27  !           body table. ObsSpaceData_mod currently populates the list with one
  28  !           of:
  29  !                 all header members of a given family
  30  !                 all   body members of a given family
  31  !                 all   body members of a given header row index
  32  !
  33  !:Usage:
  34  !    An ObsSpaceData_mod client must first call either
  35  !    obs_set_current_body_list or obs_set_current_header_list, specifying
  36  !    either the family of interest or the header row index of interest. 
  37  !    This does not return the list directly to the caller, but rather writes
  38  !    the list, as a struct_index_list, to the private contents of the obs
  39  !    oject that is returned to the caller but which cannot be examined by the
  40  !    caller.  Two lists can be active simultaneously:  one header list and
  41  !    one body list.
  42  !
  43  !    In order to access the indices that are in the list, the
  44  !    ObsSpaceData_mod client must call either obs_getHeaderIndex or
  45  !    obs_getBodyIndex, giving the ObsSpaceData object as the only argument. 
  46  !    On each call, one index is returned.  On calls after the last index in
  47  !    the list, a value of -1 is returned.
  48  !
  49  !    This is not a fully fledged module.  It is better described as a
  50  !    structure definition with a couple of helpful methods.  It is intended
  51  !    that the client, ObsSpaceData_mod, read/write directly from/to instances
  52  !    of these structures.
  53
  54
  55
  56  ! STRUCT_INDEX_LIST:
  57  !    A struct_index_list contains the identity of the family or header that
  58  !    was used to create the list, the actual list of indices, and the number
  59  !    of the list element that was last returned to the user.
  60  !
  61  ! STRUCT_INDEX_LIST_DEPOT:
  62  !    Because it is typical for a client to traverse a small group of lists
  63  !    several times each, performance is improved by retaining recent lists,
  64  !    thus avoiding having to regenerate them on each request.  Recent lists
  65  !    are stored in a struct_index_list_depot.  ObsSpaceData_mod contains one
  66  !    struct_index_list_depot for header lists and another for body lists.
  67  !    The struct_index_list_depot structure contains current_list, a pointer
  68  !    to the list in the depot that was last requested by the ObsSpaceData_mod
  69  !    client.
  70  !
  71  ! OMP:
  72  !    ObsSpaceData_mod has been designed so that it may be called from within
  73  !    an OMP section of code.  If there are n OMP threads, it is possible that
  74  !    there be as many as n lists in use simultaneously.  The parameter, 
  75  !    NUMBER_OF_LISTS, has been set to n to accommodate that many threads.  In
  76  !    this case, because the current_list of the depot is not OMP-private, it
  77  !    cannot be asked to remember the current list for each of the OMP
  78  !    threads.  Therefore, obs_set_current_header/body_list returns to the
  79  !    client an additional pointer to the list itself.  This pointer must then
  80  !    be passed as an optional parameter to obs_getHeader/BodyIndex.  When a
  81  !    new list is requested by an OMP thread, the same physical memory is
  82  !    re-used for the new list.
  83  !
  84  !    In order to ensure that the same physical memory is not initially
  85  !    distributed to more than one OMP thread, the two small sections of
  86  !    IndexListDepot_mod that accomplish this are marked omp-critical.
  87  !
  88
  89   implicit none
  90   save
  91   public
  92
  93   ! methods
  94   public :: ild_initialize             ! initialize a list depot
  95   public :: ild_finalize               ! finalize a list depot
  96   public :: ild_get_empty_index_list   ! return a pointer to an initialized list
  97   public :: ild_get_next_index         ! return the next element in the list
  98
  99   interface ild_get_next_index
 100      module procedure ild_get_next_index_depot
 101      module procedure ild_get_next_index_private
 102   end interface ild_get_next_index
 103
 104                                        ! This dimension must accommodate the
 105                                        ! maximum number of OMP processors 
 106   integer, parameter :: NUMBER_OF_LISTS = 32
 107
 108   type struct_index_list
 109      ! a list of integers, not to say indices into a struct_obs
 110      character(len=2) :: family        ! current_element's belong to this family
 111                                        ! Used only for a body list:
 112      integer :: header                 ! current_element's belong to this header
 113      integer :: current_element        ! the element that has just been returned
 114
 115                                        ! the actual list of integers
 116                                        ! N.B.:  These are the indices that are
 117                                        !        being held for the client.
 118                                        !        In the context of this module,
 119                                        !        these are elements; i.e. row
 120                                        !        indices.  Current_element is the
 121                                        !        last index that was returned
 122                                        !        to the client.
 123      integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: indices
 124   end type struct_index_list
 125
 126   type struct_index_list_depot
 127      ! A collection of lists, either empty or populated
 128                                        ! the collection of lists
 129      type(struct_index_list), dimension(NUMBER_OF_LISTS) :: index_lists
 130      integer :: list_last_attributed   ! list that was populated most recently
 131                                        ! list that was   used    most recently
 132      type(struct_index_list), pointer :: current_list
 133   end type struct_index_list_depot
 134
 135
 136contains
 137
 138   subroutine ild_finalize( depot )
 139      !
 140      !:Purpose: Finalize the indicated list depot
 141      !
 142      implicit none
 143
 144      type(struct_index_list_depot), intent(inout) :: depot ! the depot to be finalized
 145
 146      integer :: list                   ! an index
 147
 148      ! Deallocate each list
 149      do list = 1,NUMBER_OF_LISTS
 150         depot%index_lists(list)%family = 'xx'
 151         depot%index_lists(list)%header = 0
 152         depot%index_lists(list)%current_element = 0
 153         deallocate(depot%index_lists(list)%indices)
 154      end do
 155      depot%list_last_attributed = 0
 156   end subroutine ild_finalize
 157
 158
 159   function ild_get_empty_index_list( depot, private_list ) &
 160                                                         result(empty_index_list)
 161      !
 162      !:Purpose: From the given depot, return an index-list structure that contains
 163      !           no data, as a pointer.
 164      !           In other words, clear data from the (cyclicly) next (i.e. oldest)
 165      !           list and return a pointer to it.
 166      !
 167      !           If the list is being used within an OMP block, the ObsSpaceData
 168      !           client is responsible for holding a pointer to its own list.  This
 169      !           is supplied as the parameter, private_list.
 170      !
 171      implicit none
 172
 173      type(struct_index_list), pointer                     :: empty_index_list  ! the returned list
 174      type(struct_index_list_depot), intent(inout), target :: depot             ! the depot containing the list
 175      type(struct_index_list), pointer, intent(inout), optional :: private_list ! used instead of depot (for OMP blocks)
 176
 177      nullify(empty_index_list)
 178
 179      if(present(private_list)) then
 180         ! This is an OMP thread
 181         if(associated(private_list)) then
 182            ! Memory has already been assigned for that thread.  Re-use it.
 183            empty_index_list => private_list ! Set the return pointer
 184         end if
 185      end if
 186
 187      if(.not. associated(empty_index_list)) then
 188!$omp critical
 189         ! Increment (cyclicly) the index to the next list
 190         depot%list_last_attributed = depot%list_last_attributed + 1
 191         if (depot%list_last_attributed > NUMBER_OF_LISTS) &
 192            depot%list_last_attributed = 1
 193
 194         ! Set the return pointer
 195         empty_index_list => depot%index_lists(depot%list_last_attributed)
 196!$omp end critical
 197      end if
 198
 199      ! Initialize some values in the list
 200      ! empty_index_list%indices(:) = -1 --> No, the array is too big.
 201      empty_index_list%family = '  '
 202      empty_index_list%header = -1
 203      empty_index_list%current_element = 0
 204
 205      return
 206   end function ild_get_empty_index_list
 207
 208
 209   function ild_get_next_index_depot(depot, no_advance) result(next_index)
 210      !
 211      !:Purpose: From the given depot, increment the index to the current element,
 212      !           and return the element itself, the new current element.
 213      !
 214      implicit none
 215
 216      integer :: next_index                                                ! the returned index
 217      type(struct_index_list_depot), intent(inout), target :: depot        ! the depot containing the list
 218                                                                           ! if present, do not increment
 219      logical, intent(in), optional                        :: no_advance   ! current_element, just return next one
 220      type(struct_index_list), pointer                     :: current_list ! current list of the depot
 221      integer                                              :: next_element ! next element of the current list
 222
 223      current_list => depot%current_list
 224!$omp critical
 225                                        ! Obtain the next element from the list
 226      next_element = current_list%current_element + 1
 227      next_index = current_list%indices(next_element)
 228      if(.not. present(no_advance) .and. next_index /= -1) then
 229                                        ! Increment the current element
 230         current_list%current_element = next_element
 231      end if
 232!$omp end critical
 233   end function ild_get_next_index_depot
 234
 235
 236   function ild_get_next_index_private(private_list, no_advance) &
 237                                                               result(next_index)
 238      !
 239      !:Purpose:  From the given list, increment the index to the current element, and
 240      !            return the element itself, the new current element.
 241      !
 242      implicit none
 243      integer :: next_index                                           ! the returned index
 244      type(struct_index_list), pointer, intent(inout) :: private_list ! the list of interest
 245                                                                      ! if present, do not increment
 246      logical, intent(in), optional                   :: no_advance   ! current_element, just return next one
 247      integer                                         :: next_element ! next element of the list
 248
 249                                        ! Obtain the next element from the list
 250      next_element = private_list%current_element + 1
 251      next_index = private_list%indices(next_element)
 252
 253      if(.not. present(no_advance) .and. next_index /= -1) then
 254                                        ! Increment the current element
 255         private_list%current_element = next_element
 256      end if
 257   end function ild_get_next_index_private
 258
 259
 260   subroutine ild_initialize(depot, numHeaderBody_max)
 261      !
 262      !:Purpose: Initialize the indicated list depot
 263      !   
 264      !:Note: indices is allocated with 2 extra elements to make room for
 265      !        the end-of-list flag that is set in
 266      !        obs_set_current_header/body_list
 267      !
 268      implicit none
 269
 270      type(struct_index_list_depot), intent(inout) :: depot ! the depot to be initialized
 271                                                            ! max size of header or body of
 272                                                            ! struct_obs & hence of depot
 273      integer, intent(in) :: numHeaderBody_max
 274      integer :: list                   ! an index
 275
 276      ! Allocate each list
 277      do list = 1,NUMBER_OF_LISTS
 278         depot%index_lists(list)%family = 'xx'
 279         depot%index_lists(list)%header = 0
 280         depot%index_lists(list)%current_element = 0
 281         allocate(depot%index_lists(list)%indices(numHeaderBody_max+2))
 282         depot%index_lists(list)%indices(:)=0
 283      end do
 284      depot%list_last_attributed = 0
 285      nullify(depot%current_list)
 286   end subroutine ild_initialize
 287
 288end module IndexListDepot_mod
 289

 292module ObsColumnNames_mod
 293  ! MODULE obsColumnNames_mod (prefix='ocn' category='7. Low-level data objects and utilities')
 294  !
 295  !:Purpose: This module simply groups together many fortran paramters that
 296  !           serve as column names for ObsSpaceData_mod.
 297  !
 298  !:NOTE: This module is logistically a part of the ObsSpaceData_mod module.
 299  !        In fact, if fortran allowed it, ObsColumnNames_mod would be
 300  !        'contain'ed inside the ObsSpaceData_mod module. For this reason, and
 301  !        more importantly because these parameters constitute a part of the
 302  !        visible (from outside ObsSpaceData_mod) interface to
 303  !        ObsSpaceData_mod, the parameters defined in this module carry the
 304  !        prefix, OBS, and not CN.
 305  !
 306
 307   public
 308
 309
 310   !
 311   ! INTEGER-HEADER COLUMN NUMBERS
 312   !  
 313   ! the first column index for integer header variables defined below
 314   ! (chosen such that every column number is unique, so that a mismatch between
 315   !  a column number and a column type (real, int, head, body) can be detected)
 316   integer, parameter :: NHDR_INT_BEG = 101
 317   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_RLN = NHDR_INT_BEG ! report location
 318                                             ! unique(within obsdat), possibly
 319   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_ONM = OBS_RLN+1  ! ordered, station id number
 320   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_INS = OBS_ONM+1  ! instrument ID  
 321   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_OTP = OBS_INS+1  ! observation Type (file index)
 322   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_ITY = OBS_OTP+1  ! code: instrument & retrieval type
 323   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_SAT = OBS_ITY+1  ! satellite code 
 324   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_TEC = OBS_SAT+1  ! satellite processing technique
 325   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_SEN = OBS_TEC+1  ! satellite sensor code
 326   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_DAT = OBS_SEN+1  ! observation date YYYYMMD
 327   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_ETM = OBS_DAT+1  ! observation time HHMM
 328   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_NLV = OBS_ETM+1  ! number of data at this location
 329   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_PAS = OBS_NLV+1  ! batch no. in sequential analysis
 330   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_REG = OBS_PAS+1  ! region number in the batch
 331   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_IP  = OBS_REG+1  ! number of mpi processors
 332   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_IPF = OBS_IP+1   ! mpi task id for file
 333   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_IPC = OBS_IPF+1  ! mpi task id for column/obsspacedata
 334   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_IPT = OBS_IPC+1  ! mpi task id for latlontile
 335   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_ST1 = OBS_IPT+1  ! header level status/rejection flag
 336   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_IDF = OBS_ST1+1  ! id. no. of observation-source file
 337
 338   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_GQF = OBS_IDF+1  ! iasi GQISFLAGQUAL: general quality flag which indicates,
 339                                                      ! when it is set to TRUE (=1), that some anomaly has been
 340                                                      ! detected at some step in the Level 0 or Level 1 IASI Processing.
 341                                                      ! The products should not be used if this occurs.
 342
 343   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_GQL = OBS_GQF+1  ! iasi GQISQUALINDEXLOC: It is defined as the uncertainty of the
 344                                                      ! coregistration between IIS (IASI internal imager) and AVHRR.
 345
 346   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_NCO2= OBS_GQL+1  ! NCO2: number of valid CO2 slicing estimates (AIRS,IASI,CrIS)
 347   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_STYP= OBS_NCO2+1 ! surface type in obs file (0,1,2)
 348   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_ROQF= OBS_STYP+1 ! QUALITY FLAGS FOR RADIO OCCULTATION DATA
 349   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_SWQ1= OBS_ROQF+1 ! QUALITY VALUES FOR SW (AMV) DATA
 350   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_SWQ2= OBS_SWQ1+1 ! QUALITY VALUES FOR SW (AMV) DATA
 351   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_SWMT= OBS_SWQ2+1 ! QUALITY VALUES FOR SW (AMV) DATA
 352   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_SWLS= OBS_SWMT+1 ! QUALITY VALUES FOR SW (AMV) DATA
 353   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_SWGA= OBS_SWLS+1 ! QUALITY VALUES FOR SW (AMV) DATA
 354   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_SWHA= OBS_SWGA+1 ! QUALITY VALUES FOR SW (AMV) DATA
 355   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_CHM = OBS_SWHA+1 ! BUFR code (table 08046) of constituent type (for the CH family)
 356   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_FOV = OBS_CHM+1  ! field of view 
 357   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_PRFL= OBS_FOV+1  ! profile id. number
 358   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_PHAS= OBS_PRFL+1 ! phase of flight
 359   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_ORI = OBS_PHAS+1 ! originating centre code
 360   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_LCH = OBS_ORI+1  ! launch time (hhmm)
 361   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_RTP = OBS_LCH+1  ! radiosonde type code
 362   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_HDD = OBS_RTP+1  ! date in burp header
 363   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_HDT = OBS_HDD+1  ! time in burp header
 364   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_TFLG= OBS_HDT+1  ! flag for hi-res time element
 365   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_LFLG= OBS_TFLG+1 ! flag for hi-res lat element
 366   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_ORBI= OBS_LFLG+1! satellite orbit index
 367   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_AQF1= OBS_ORBI+1! ATMS Geolocalisation Quality Control Flag 
 368   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_AQF2= OBS_AQF1+1! ATMS Granule Level Quality Control Flag 
 369   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_AQF3= OBS_AQF2+1! ATMS Scan Level Quality Control Flag 
 370   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_TTYP= OBS_AQF3+1! TERRAIN TYP INDICE for TOVS QC
 371   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_INFG= OBS_TTYP+1! SATPLOT INFO FLAG for TOVS
 372   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_RAIN= OBS_INFG+1! UKMO rain flag for ssmis obs
 373   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_CHID= OBS_RAIN+1! id. no. of ice chart
 374
 375
 376   ! the last column index for integer header variables defined just above
 377   integer, parameter :: NHDR_INT_END = OBS_CHID
 378
 379   integer, parameter :: NHDR_INT_SIZE = NHDR_INT_END - NHDR_INT_BEG + 1
 380
 381   !
 382   ! INTEGER-HEADER COLUMN NAMES
 383   !
 384   character(len=4), target :: ocn_ColumnNameList_IH(NHDR_INT_BEG:NHDR_INT_END) = &
 385      (/ 'RLN ','ONM ','INS ','OTP ','ITY ','SAT ','TEC ','SEN ','DAT ','ETM ', &  
 386         'NLV ','PAS ','REG ','IP  ','IPF ','IPC ','IPT ', &  
 387         'ST1 ','IDF ','GQF ','GQL ','NCO2','STYP','ROQF', &
 388         'SWQ1','SWQ2','SWMT','SWLS','SWGA','SWHA','CHM ','FOV ', &
 389         'PRFL','PHAS','ORI ','LCH ','RTP ','HDD ','HDT ','TFLG',&
 390         'LFLG','ORBI','AQF1','AQF2','AQF3','TTYP','INFG','RAIN','CHID'/)
 391
 392   !
 393   ! REAL-HEADER COLUMN NUMBERS
 394   !
 395   ! the first column index for real header variables defined below
 396   ! (chosen such that every column number is unique, so that a mismatch between
 397   !  a column number and a column type (real, int, head, body) can be detected)
 398   integer, parameter :: NHDR_REAL_BEG = 201
 399   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_LAT = NHDR_REAL_BEG  ! latitude  in radians (N positive)
 400   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_LON = OBS_LAT+1 ! longitude in radians (E positive)
 401   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_ALT = OBS_LON+1 ! station altitude
 402   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_BX  = OBS_ALT+1 ! x-coordinate of block in R3
 403   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_BY  = OBS_BX +1 ! y-coordinate of block in R3
 404   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_BZ  = OBS_BY +1 ! z-coordinate of block in R3
 405
 406   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M1C1  = OBS_BZ +1   ! mean for class 1 AVHRR channel 1
 407   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M1C2  = OBS_M1C1 +1 ! mean for class 1 AVHRR channel 2
 408   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M1C3  = OBS_M1C2 +1 ! mean for class 1 AVHRR channel 3
 409   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M1C4  = OBS_M1C3 +1 ! mean for class 1 AVHRR channel 4
 410   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M1C5  = OBS_M1C4 +1 ! mean for class 1 AVHRR channel 5
 411   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M1C6  = OBS_M1C5 +1 ! mean for class 1 AVHRR channel 6
 412
 413   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M2C1  = OBS_M1C6 +1 ! mean for class 2 AVHRR channel 1
 414   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M2C2  = OBS_M2C1 +1 ! mean for class 2 AVHRR channel 2
 415   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M2C3  = OBS_M2C2 +1 ! mean for class 2 AVHRR channel 3
 416   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M2C4  = OBS_M2C3 +1 ! mean for class 2 AVHRR channel 4
 417   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M2C5  = OBS_M2C4 +1 ! mean for class 2 AVHRR channel 5
 418   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M2C6  = OBS_M2C5 +1 ! mean for class 2 AVHRR channel 6
 419
 420   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M3C1  = OBS_M2C6 +1 ! mean for class 3 AVHRR channel 1
 421   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M3C2  = OBS_M3C1 +1 ! mean for class 3 AVHRR channel 2
 422   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M3C3  = OBS_M3C2 +1 ! mean for class 3 AVHRR channel 3
 423   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M3C4  = OBS_M3C3 +1 ! mean for class 3 AVHRR channel 4
 424   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M3C5  = OBS_M3C4 +1 ! mean for class 3 AVHRR channel 5
 425   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M3C6  = OBS_M3C5 +1 ! mean for class 3 AVHRR channel 6
 426
 427   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M4C1  = OBS_M3C6 +1 ! mean for class 4 AVHRR channel 1
 428   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M4C2  = OBS_M4C1 +1 ! mean for class 4 AVHRR channel 2
 429   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M4C3  = OBS_M4C2 +1 ! mean for class 4 AVHRR channel 3
 430   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M4C4  = OBS_M4C3 +1 ! mean for class 4 AVHRR channel 4
 431   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M4C5  = OBS_M4C4 +1 ! mean for class 4 AVHRR channel 5
 432   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M4C6  = OBS_M4C5 +1 ! mean for class 4 AVHRR channel 6
 433
 434   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M5C1  = OBS_M4C6 +1 ! mean for class 5 AVHRR channel 1
 435   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M5C2  = OBS_M5C1 +1 ! mean for class 5 AVHRR channel 2
 436   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M5C3  = OBS_M5C2 +1 ! mean for class 5 AVHRR channel 3
 437   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M5C4  = OBS_M5C3 +1 ! mean for class 5 AVHRR channel 4
 438   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M5C5  = OBS_M5C4 +1 ! mean for class 5 AVHRR channel 5
 439   integer, parameter, public :: OBS_M5C6  = OBS_M5C5 +1 ! mean for class 5 AVHRR channel 6
 440

 648
 649module ObsDataColumn_mod
 650  !
 651  ! MODULE obsDataColumn_mod (prefix='odc' category='7. Low-level data objects and utilities')
 652  !
 653  !:Purpose:
 654  !    This module is used exclusively by the obsSpaceData module which follows
 655  !    in this file. The derived type is used to represent a "column" of
 656  !    observation data in an instance of the struct_obs defined in obsSpaceData.
 657  !    It contains a pointer for each possible type of data stored in a column,
 658  !    but only one should be allocated at any time.
 659  !
 660   use codePrecision_mod
 661   use ObsColumnNames_mod
 662   implicit none
 663   save
 664   private
 665
 666   ! CLASS-CONSTANT:
 667   ! CLASS-CONSTANT:
 668   ! CLASS-CONSTANT:
 669
 670   ! This type gathers together into one structure the various CLASS-CONSTANT
 671   ! characteristics of a data column.  Four instances (flavours) of this derived
 672   ! type are defined below.
 673   type, public :: struct_odc_flavour
 674                                        ! These 2 values are informational only.
 675                                        ! They are used in error messages.
 676      character(len=4) :: dataType      ! REAL or INT
 677      character(len=4) :: headOrBody    ! HEAD or BODY
 678
 679      integer :: ncol_beg, ncol_end
 680      logical         , dimension(:), pointer :: columnActive   ! indexed from 1
 681      character(len=4), dimension(:), pointer :: columnNameList
 682
 683      integer,dimension(:), pointer ::activeIndexFromColumnIndex
 684      logical :: activeIndexFromColumnIndex_defined
 685
 686      integer,dimension(:), pointer ::columnIndexFromActiveIndex
 687      logical :: columnIndexFromActiveIndex_defined
 688   end type struct_odc_flavour
 689
 690   ! The four CLASS-CONSTANT flavours of data columns:
 691   !    Integer / Real  +  Body / Header
 692   type(struct_odc_flavour), public, target :: odc_flavour_IB, &
 693                                               odc_flavour_IH, &
 694                                               odc_flavour_RB, &
 695                                               odc_flavour_RH
 696   ! end of CLASS-CONSTANT objects
 697   ! end of CLASS-CONSTANT objects
 698   ! end of CLASS-CONSTANT objects
 699
 700
 701   ! methods
 702   public :: odc_allocate, odc_deallocate, odc_class_initialize
 703   public :: odc_initAllColumnFlavours
 704   public :: odc_activateColumn, odc_numActiveColumn
 705   public :: odc_columnElem, odc_columnSet
 706   public :: odc_columnIndexFromActiveIndex, odc_activeIndexFromColumnIndex
 707
 708   ! This type allows a single derived type to contain either a real or an int
 709   type, public :: struct_obsDataColumn
 710      logical          :: allocated = .false.
 711                                        ! For these arrays:
 712                                        !   1st dim'n:  row index (element index)
 713      integer,          pointer :: value_i(:)     => NULL()
 714      real(pre_obsReal),pointer :: value_r(:)     => NULL()
 715      character(len=4) :: dataType
 716   end type struct_obsDataColumn
 717
 718
 719   ! This type contains one array of data columns.  Four of these are necessary
 720   ! to constitute a complete set of observation data (struct_obs).
 721   type, public :: struct_obsDataColumn_Array
 722                                        ! CLASS-CONSTANT values (1 of 4 flavours)
 723      type(struct_odc_flavour), pointer :: odc_flavour => NULL()
 724                                        ! object-specific values
 725                                        !   1st dim'n: column index (column name)
 726      type(struct_obsDataColumn), dimension(:), pointer :: columns => NULL()
 727   end type struct_obsDataColumn_Array
 728  
 729
 730   ! These arrays store the status of the columns.  An active column is 
 731   ! allocated (and can therefore be used) in any object that is instantiated.
 732   logical, target :: columnActive_IH(NHDR_INT_BEG:NHDR_INT_END ) = .false.
 733   logical, target :: columnActive_RH(NHDR_REAL_BEG:NHDR_REAL_END) = .false.
 734   logical, target :: columnActive_IB(NBDY_INT_BEG:NBDY_INT_END ) = .false.
 735   logical, target :: columnActive_RB(NBDY_REAL_BEG:NBDY_REAL_END) = .false.
 736
 737   integer, target :: activeIndexFromColumnIndex_IB(NBDY_INT_BEG:NBDY_INT_END)
 738   integer, target :: activeIndexFromColumnIndex_IH(NHDR_INT_BEG:NHDR_INT_END)
 739   integer, target :: activeIndexFromColumnIndex_RB(NBDY_REAL_BEG:NBDY_REAL_END)
 740   integer, target :: activeIndexFromColumnIndex_RH(NHDR_REAL_BEG:NHDR_REAL_END)
 741
 742   integer, target :: columnIndexFromActiveIndex_IB(NBDY_INT_SIZE)
 743   integer, target :: columnIndexFromActiveIndex_IH(NHDR_INT_SIZE)
 744   integer, target :: columnIndexFromActiveIndex_RB(NBDY_REAL_SIZE)
 745   integer, target :: columnIndexFromActiveIndex_RH(NHDR_REAL_SIZE)
 746
 747   integer, public, parameter :: odc_ENKF_bdy_int_column_list(8) = &
 748      (/OBS_VNM, OBS_FLG, OBS_ASS, OBS_HIND, OBS_VCO, OBS_LYR, &
 749        OBS_QCF2, OBS_CLA /)
 750   integer, public, parameter :: odc_ENKF_bdy_real_column_list(15) = &
 751      (/OBS_PPP, OBS_SEM, OBS_VAR,  OBS_OMP,  OBS_OMA,  OBS_OER,  OBS_HPHT,&
 752        OBS_HAHT,OBS_ZHA, OBS_OMP6, OBS_OMA0, OBS_SIGI, OBS_SIGO, OBS_LATD,&
 753        OBS_LOND /)
 754
 755contains
 756
 757   subroutine odc_abort(cdmessage)
 758     !
 759     !:Purpose: Abort a job on error (same as OBS_ABORT)
 760     !
 761     !:Arguments:
 762     !           :cdmessage: message to be printed
 763     !
 764     !:Note: For debugging (i.e. UNIT_TESTING is defined), obs_abort should
 765     !        generally be followed by a 'return' in the calling routine.
 766
 767!#if defined(UNIT_TESTING)
 768!      use pFUnit
 769!#endif
 770      implicit none
 771      character(len=*), intent(in) :: cdmessage
 772
 773      write(*,'(//,4X,"ABORTING IN ObsDataColumn_mod:-------",/,8X,A)')cdmessage
 774      call flush(6)
 775
 776!#if defined(UNIT_TESTING)
 777!      call throw(Exception('exiting in odc_abort:' // cdmessage))
 778!#else
 779      call qqexit(1)
 780      stop
 781!#endif
 782   end subroutine odc_abort
 783
 784
 785   function odc_activeIndexFromColumnIndex(odc_flavour,column_index_in, &
 786                                           recompute) result(active_index_out)
 787      !
 788      !:Purpose: The list of active columns is only a subset of all possible
 789      !           columns.  Return the index into the list of active columns, given
 790      !           the index into the list of all columns.
 791      !
 792      implicit none
 793      type(struct_odc_flavour), intent(inout) :: odc_flavour
 794      integer                 , intent(in)    :: column_index_in
 795      logical, optional       , intent(in)    :: recompute
 796      integer                                 :: active_index_out
 797
 798      integer :: active_index, &
 799                 column_index
 800      character(len=100) :: message
 801
 802      if(present(recompute)) then
 803         if(recompute) odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex_defined=.false.
 804      endif
 805
 806      if(.not. odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex_defined) then
 807         odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex_defined=.true.
 808         active_index=0
 809         odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex(:)=-1
 810
 811         do column_index = odc_flavour%ncol_beg, odc_flavour%ncol_end
 812            if(odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index)) then
 813               active_index=active_index+1
 814               odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex(column_index) =active_index
 815            endif
 816         enddo
 817      endif
 818
 819      active_index_out=odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex(column_index_in)
 820
 821      if(active_index_out == -1) then
 822         write(message,*)'ODC_activeIndexFromColumnIndex: requested column is ',&
 823                         'not active!  Column name is ', &
 824                         odc_flavour%columnNameList(column_index_in)
 825         call odc_abort(message)
 826      end if
 827   end function odc_activeIndexFromColumnIndex
 828
 829
 830   subroutine odc_allocate( odc, numRows, name, dataType, scratchReal, scratchInt )
 831     !
 832     !:Purpose: Allocate a single column of obs data according to 
 833     !           specifications in input arguments
 834     !
 835     !:Arguments:
 836     !           :odc:        instance of the obsDataColumn type
 837     !           :numRows:    number of column rows to allocate
 838     !           :name:       character string name of column
 839     !           :dataType:   character string type of column data: REAL or INT
 840     !           :headOrBody: character string indicating HEAD or BODY
 841     !
 842     !
 843      implicit none
 844      type(struct_obsDataColumn), intent(inout) :: odc
 845      integer, intent(in) :: numRows
 846      character(len=*), intent(in) :: name,dataType
 847      real(pre_obsReal), pointer, intent(in) :: scratchReal(:)
 848      integer          , pointer, intent(in) :: scratchInt(:)
 849
 850      if(odc%allocated) then
 851         call odc_abort('ODC_ALLOCATE: column is already allocated. name=' &
 852                        // name)
 853         return
 854      endif
 855
 856      odc%allocated=.true.
 857      odc%dataType = dataType
 858
 859      select case (trim(dataType))
 860      case ('INT')
 861         allocate(odc%value_i(numRows))
 862         odc%value_i(:)=0
 863         odc%value_r   => scratchReal
 864
 865      case ('REAL')
 866         allocate(odc%value_r(numRows))
 867         odc%value_r(:)=real(0.0D0, pre_obsReal)
 868         odc%value_i   => scratchInt
 869
 870      case default
 871         call odc_abort('ODC_ALLOCATE: unknown data type. type=' // dataType)
 872      end select
 873
 874   end subroutine odc_allocate
 875
 876
 877   subroutine odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour, column_index)
 878      !
 879      !:Purpose: Set the 'active' flag for the indicated column.  This enables memory
 880      !           allocation for this column without actually allocating the memory.
 881      !
 882      implicit none
 883      type(struct_odc_flavour), intent(inout)  :: odc_flavour
 884      integer, intent(in) :: column_index
 885
 886      integer :: active_index, dummy_index
 887
 888      if(.not.odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index)) then
 889         odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index) = .true.
 890      endif
 891
 892      ! force the recalculation of indices to go between activeColumnIndex and
 893      ! columnIndex
 894      active_index=odc_activeIndexFromColumnIndex(odc_flavour,column_index, &
 895                                                  recompute=.true.)
 896      dummy_index =odc_columnIndexFromActiveIndex(odc_flavour,active_index, &
 897                                                  recompute=.true.)
 898   end subroutine odc_activateColumn
 899
 900
 901   subroutine odc_initColumnFlavour(odc_flavour, dataType_in, headOrBody_in)
 902      !
 903      !:Purpose: Set pointers according to the four column flavours (header /
 904      !           body, integer / real).
 905      !      
 906      type(struct_odc_flavour), intent(inout) :: odc_flavour
 907      character(len=*)        , intent(in)    :: dataType_in    ! REAL or INT
 908      character(len=*)        , intent(in)    :: headOrBody_in  ! HEAD or BODY
 909
 910      odc_flavour%dataType   = trim(dataType_in)
 911      odc_flavour%headOrBody = trim(headOrBody_in)
 912
 913      select case (trim(dataType_in))
 914      case ('REAL')
 915         select case (trim(headOrBody_in))
 916         case ('HEAD')
 917            odc_flavour%ncol_beg = NHDR_REAL_BEG
 918            odc_flavour%ncol_end = NHDR_REAL_END
 919            odc_flavour%columnActive   => columnActive_RH
 920            odc_flavour%columnNameList => ocn_ColumnNameList_RH
 921            odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex=>activeIndexFromColumnIndex_RH
 922            odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex_defined = .false.
 923            odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex=>columnIndexFromActiveIndex_RH
 924            odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex_defined = .false.
 925         case ('BODY')
 926            odc_flavour%ncol_beg = NBDY_REAL_BEG
 927            odc_flavour%ncol_end = NBDY_REAL_END
 928            odc_flavour%columnActive   => columnActive_RB
 929            odc_flavour%columnNameList => ocn_ColumnNameList_RB
 930            odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex=>activeIndexFromColumnIndex_RB
 931            odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex_defined = .false.
 932            odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex=>columnIndexFromActiveIndex_RB
 933            odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex_defined = .false.
 934         end select
 935
 936      case ('INT')
 937         select case (trim(headOrBody_in))
 938         case ('HEAD')
 939            odc_flavour%ncol_beg = NHDR_INT_BEG
 940            odc_flavour%ncol_end = NHDR_INT_END
 941            odc_flavour%columnActive   => columnActive_IH
 942            odc_flavour%columnNameList => ocn_ColumnNameList_IH
 943            odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex=>activeIndexFromColumnIndex_IH
 944            odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex_defined = .false.
 945            odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex=>columnIndexFromActiveIndex_IH
 946            odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex_defined = .false. 
 947         case ('BODY') 
 948            odc_flavour%ncol_beg = NBDY_INT_BEG
 949            odc_flavour%ncol_end = NBDY_INT_END
 950            odc_flavour%columnActive   => columnActive_IB
 951            odc_flavour%columnNameList => ocn_ColumnNameList_IB
 952            odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex=>activeIndexFromColumnIndex_IB
 953            odc_flavour%activeIndexFromColumnIndex_defined = .false.
 954            odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex=>columnIndexFromActiveIndex_IB
 955            odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex_defined = .false.
 956         end select
 957      end select
 958
 959   end subroutine odc_initColumnFlavour
 960
 961
 962   subroutine odc_initAllColumnFlavours()
 963      !
 964      !:Purpose: Initialize the 4 flavours of odc
 965      !
 966      implicit none
 967
 968      ! locals
 969      logical, save :: firstCall = .true.
 970
 971      if (firstCall) then
 972        firstCall = .false.
 973        ! Initialize the four column flavours:
 974        call odc_initColumnFlavour(odc_flavour_IB, 'INT',  'BODY')
 975        call odc_initColumnFlavour(odc_flavour_IH, 'INT',  'HEAD')
 976        call odc_initColumnFlavour(odc_flavour_RB, 'REAL', 'BODY')
 977        call odc_initColumnFlavour(odc_flavour_RH, 'REAL', 'HEAD')
 978      end if
 979
 980   end subroutine odc_initAllColumnFlavours
 981
 982
 983   subroutine odc_class_initialize(obsColumnMode)
 984      !
 985      !:Purpose: Set variables that use the same values for all instances of the class.
 986      !
 987      implicit none
 988      ! mode controlling the subset of columns that are activated in all objects
 989      character(len=*), intent(in) :: obsColumnMode
 990
 991      integer :: column_index, list_index, ii
 992      integer, parameter :: COLUMN_LIST_SIZE = 100
 993      integer, dimension(COLUMN_LIST_SIZE) :: hdr_int_column_list, &
 994                  hdr_real_column_list, bdy_int_column_list, bdy_real_column_list
 995
 996      ! Initialize the four column flavours:
 997      call odc_initAllColumnFlavours()
 998
 999      COLUMN_MODE:if(trim(obsColumnMode) == 'ALL') then
1000         do column_index=NHDR_INT_BEG,NHDR_INT_END
1001            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_IH, column_index)
1002         enddo
1003         do column_index=NHDR_REAL_BEG,NHDR_REAL_END
1004            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_RH, column_index)
1005         enddo
1006         do column_index=NBDY_INT_BEG,NBDY_INT_END
1007            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_IB, column_index)
1008         enddo
1009         do column_index=NBDY_REAL_BEG,NBDY_REAL_END
1010            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_RB, column_index)
1011         enddo
1012
1013      elseif(trim(obsColumnMode) == 'ENKF') then COLUMN_MODE
1014
1015         hdr_int_column_list= &
1016            (/OBS_RLN, OBS_ONM, OBS_INS, OBS_OTP, OBS_ITY, OBS_SAT, OBS_TEC, &
1017              OBS_DAT, OBS_ETM, OBS_NLV, OBS_STYP, OBS_PAS, OBS_REG, OBS_IP,  &
1018              OBS_ST1, OBS_IDF, OBS_SEN, &
1019              OBS_GQF, OBS_GQL, OBS_ROQF, (0,ii=21,100) /)
1020
1021         hdr_real_column_list= &
1022            (/OBS_LAT, OBS_LON, OBS_ALT, OBS_BX,  OBS_BY,  OBS_BZ, OBS_TRAD, &
1023              OBS_GEOI,OBS_CLF,OBS_SUN,OBS_SZA,OBS_AZA,OBS_SAZ, &
1024              OBS_RZAM, OBS_RELE, OBS_RANS, OBS_RANE, (0,ii=18,100)/)
1025
1026         bdy_int_column_list(:)    = 0
1027         bdy_int_column_list(1:size(odc_ENKF_bdy_int_column_list)) = &
1028            odc_ENKF_bdy_int_column_list(:)
1029
1030         bdy_real_column_list(:)   = 0
1031         bdy_real_column_list(1:size(odc_ENKF_bdy_real_column_list)) = &
1032            odc_ENKF_bdy_real_column_list(:)
1033
1034         do list_index=1,COLUMN_LIST_SIZE
1035            column_index = hdr_int_column_list(list_index)
1036            if(column_index == 0) exit
1037            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_IH, column_index)
1038         end do
1039
1040         do list_index=1,COLUMN_LIST_SIZE
1041            column_index = hdr_real_column_list(list_index)
1042            if(column_index == 0) exit
1043            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_RH, column_index)
1044         end do
1045
1046         do list_index=1,COLUMN_LIST_SIZE
1047            column_index = bdy_int_column_list(list_index)
1048            if(column_index == 0) exit
1049            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_IB, column_index)
1050         end do
1051
1052         do list_index=1,COLUMN_LIST_SIZE
1053            column_index = bdy_real_column_list(list_index)
1054            if(column_index == 0) exit
1055            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_RB, column_index)
1056         end do
1057
1058      elseif(trim(obsColumnMode) == 'ENKFMIDAS') then COLUMN_MODE
1059
1060         hdr_int_column_list= &
1061            (/OBS_RLN, OBS_ONM, OBS_INS, OBS_OTP, OBS_ITY, OBS_SAT, OBS_TEC, &
1062              OBS_DAT, OBS_ETM, OBS_NLV, OBS_STYP,OBS_PAS, OBS_REG, OBS_IP,  &
1063              OBS_ST1, OBS_IDF, OBS_SEN, &
1064              OBS_SWQ1,OBS_SWQ2,OBS_SWMT,OBS_SWLS,OBS_SWGA,OBS_SWHA, &
1065              OBS_GQF, OBS_GQL, OBS_ROQF, OBS_TTYP, (0,ii=28,100) /)
1066
1067         hdr_real_column_list= &
1068            (/OBS_LAT, OBS_LON, OBS_ALT, OBS_BX,  OBS_BY,  OBS_BZ, OBS_TRAD, &
1069              OBS_GEOI,OBS_CLF, OBS_SUN, OBS_SZA, OBS_AZA, OBS_SAZ, &
1070              OBS_RZAM, OBS_RELE, OBS_RANS, OBS_RANE, (0,ii=18,100)/)
1071
1072         bdy_int_column_list= &
1073            (/OBS_VNM, OBS_FLG, OBS_ASS, OBS_HIND,OBS_VCO, OBS_LYR, &
1074              OBS_XTR, OBS_QCF2, OBS_CLA, (0,ii=10,100) /)
1075
1076         bdy_real_column_list= &
1077            (/OBS_PPP, OBS_SEM, OBS_VAR, OBS_OMP, OBS_OMA, OBS_OMAM, OBS_OER, OBS_HPHT,&
1078              OBS_HAHT,OBS_ZHA, OBS_OMP6, OBS_OMA0, OBS_SIGI, OBS_SIGO, OBS_WORK, OBS_PRM,&
1079              OBS_JOBS, OBS_BCOR,OBS_LOND,OBS_LATD, (0,ii=21,100) /)
1080
1081         do list_index=1,COLUMN_LIST_SIZE
1082            column_index = hdr_int_column_list(list_index)
1083            if(column_index == 0) exit
1084            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_IH, column_index)
1085         end do
1086
1087         do list_index=1,COLUMN_LIST_SIZE
1088            column_index = hdr_real_column_list(list_index)
1089            if(column_index == 0) exit
1090            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_RH, column_index)
1091         end do
1092
1093         do list_index=1,COLUMN_LIST_SIZE
1094            column_index = bdy_int_column_list(list_index)
1095            if(column_index == 0) exit
1096            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_IB, column_index)
1097         end do
1098
1099         do list_index=1,COLUMN_LIST_SIZE
1100            column_index = bdy_real_column_list(list_index)
1101            if(column_index == 0) exit
1102            call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_RB, column_index)
1103         end do
1104
1105      elseif(trim(obsColumnMode) == 'VAR') then COLUMN_MODE
1106
1107         do column_index=NHDR_INT_BEG,NHDR_INT_END
1108            if( column_index < OBS_GQF .or. column_index > OBS_NCO2  &
1109              ) call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_IH, column_index)
1110         enddo
1111         do column_index=NHDR_REAL_BEG,NHDR_REAL_END
1112            if(     column_index /= OBS_BX &
1113               .and.column_index /= OBS_BY &
1114               .and.column_index /= OBS_BZ &
1115               .and. (column_index < OBS_M1C1 .or. &
1116                      column_index > OBS_ZPS) &
1117              ) call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_RH, column_index)
1118         enddo
1119
1120         do column_index=NBDY_INT_BEG,NBDY_INT_END
1121            if( column_index /= OBS_KFA ) call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_IB, column_index)
1122         enddo
1123         do column_index = NBDY_REAL_BEG, NBDY_REAL_END
1124           if(       column_index /= OBS_OMAM &
1125               .and. column_index /= OBS_OMP6 & 
1126               .and. column_index /= OBS_OMA0 &
1127               .and. column_index /= OBS_HAHT &
1128               .and. column_index /= OBS_SIGI &
1129               .and. column_index /= OBS_SIGO &
1130              )call odc_activateColumn(odc_flavour_RB, column_index)
1131         enddo
1132
1133      endif COLUMN_MODE
1134   end subroutine odc_class_initialize
1135
1136
1137   subroutine odc_columnElem(odc_array, column_index, row_index, value_i,value_r)
1138     !
1139     !:Purpose: Returns the value of the row_index'th element in the column array
1140     !           with the indicated column_index.
1141     !
1142     !           The column array can be of any one of the four possible column-array
1143     !           flavours.  The flavour is selected by one of four wrappers to this
1144     !           method.
1145     !
1146     implicit none
1147     type(struct_obsDataColumn_Array), intent(in)  :: odc_array
1148     integer                         , intent(in)  :: column_index
1149     integer                         , intent(in)  :: row_index
1150     integer                         , intent(out) :: value_i
1151     real(pre_obsReal)               , intent(out) :: value_r
1152
1153     character(len=100) :: message
1154      
1155      if(      column_index >= odc_array%odc_flavour%ncol_beg &
1156         .and. column_index <= odc_array%odc_flavour%ncol_end) then
1157         if(odc_array%odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index)) then
1158            ! Return the value (return int AND real, just to make it simple)
1159            value_i = odc_array%columns(column_index)%value_i(row_index)
1160            value_r = odc_array%columns(column_index)%value_r(row_index)
1161         else
1162            write(message,*)'abort in odc_columnElem [' &
1163                          // odc_array%odc_flavour%dataType //',' &
1164                          // odc_array%odc_flavour%headOrBody // &
1165                          ']: column not active: ', &
1166                          odc_array%odc_flavour%columnNameList(column_index)
1167            call odc_abort(message)
1168         endif
1169      else
1170         write(message,*) 'abort in odc_columnElem [' &
1171                          // odc_array%odc_flavour%dataType //',' &
1172                          // odc_array%odc_flavour%headOrBody // &
1173                          ']: column index out of range: ', column_index
1174         call odc_abort(message); return
1175      endif
1176   end subroutine odc_columnElem
1177
1178
1179   function odc_columnIndexFromActiveIndex(odc_flavour,active_index_in, &
1180                                           recompute) result(column_index_out)
1181      !
1182      !:Purpose: The list of active columns is only a subset of all possible
1183      !           columns.  Return the index into the list of all columns, given
1184      !           the index into the list of active columns, and given the column
1185      !           flavour.
1186      !
1187      implicit none
1188      type(struct_odc_flavour), intent(inout) :: odc_flavour
1189      integer                 , intent(in)    :: active_index_in
1190      logical, optional       , intent(in)    :: recompute
1191      integer                                 :: column_index_out
1192
1193      integer :: active_index, &
1194                 column_index
1195
1196      if(present(recompute)) then
1197         if(recompute) odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex_defined=.false.
1198      endif
1199
1200      if(.not. odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex_defined) then
1201         odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex_defined=.true.
1202         active_index=0
1203
1204         do column_index = odc_flavour%ncol_beg, odc_flavour%ncol_end
1205            if(odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index)) then
1206               active_index=active_index+1
1207               odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex(active_index) =column_index
1208            endif
1209         enddo
1210      endif
1211
1212      column_index_out=odc_flavour%columnIndexFromActiveIndex(active_index_in)
1213   end function odc_columnIndexFromActiveIndex
1214
1215
1216   subroutine odc_columnSet(odc_array, column_index, row_index, &
1217                            value_i, value_r, numElements, numElements_max)
1218      !
1219      !:Purpose: Sets the value of the row_index'th element in the column array with
1220      !           the indicated column_index.
1221      !
1222      !           The column array can be of any one of the four possible column-array
1223      !           flavours.  The flavour is selected by one of four wrappers to this
1224      !           method.
1225      !
1226      implicit none
1227      type(struct_obsDataColumn_Array), intent(inout) :: odc_array
1228      integer                         , intent(in)    :: column_index
1229      integer                         , intent(in)    :: row_index
1230      integer                         , intent(in)    :: value_i
1231      real(pre_obsReal)               , intent(in)    :: value_r
1232      integer                         , intent(inout) :: numElements
1233      integer                         , intent(in)    :: numElements_max
1234
1235      character(len=100) :: message
1236
1237      ! Validate the requested row_index, and
1238      ! Increment the number of elements, if necessary
1239      if(row_index > numElements_max) then
1240         write(message,*)'The requested ', &
1241                         trim(odc_array%odc_flavour%headOrBody), ' row_index, ',&
1242                         row_index,', is greater than the maximum, ', &
1243                         numElements_max
1244         call odc_abort(message)
1245
1246      else if(row_index > numElements+1) then
1247         write(message,*)'The requested ', &
1248                         trim(odc_array%odc_flavour%headOrBody), &
1249                         ' row_index, ', row_index, &
1250                         ', is beyond the next available index, ', &
1251                         numElements+1
1252         call odc_abort(message)
1253
1254      else if(row_index == numElements+1) then
1255         numElements = numElements+1
1256      end if
1257
1258
1259      ! Validate the requested column index, and
1260      ! Record the value
1261      if(      column_index >= odc_array%odc_flavour%ncol_beg &
1262         .and. column_index <= odc_array%odc_flavour%ncol_end) then
1263         if(odc_array%odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index)) then
1264            ! Record the value (record int AND real, just to make it simple)
1265            odc_array%columns(column_index)%value_i(row_index) = value_i
1266            odc_array%columns(column_index)%value_r(row_index) = value_r
1267         else
1268            write(message,*) 'abort in odc_columnSet [' &
1269                          // odc_array%odc_flavour%dataType //',' &
1270                          // odc_array%odc_flavour%headOrBody // &
1271                          ']: column not active: ', &
1272                          odc_array%odc_flavour%columnNameList(column_index)
1273            call odc_abort(message)
1274         endif
1275      else
1276         write(message,*) 'abort in odc_columnSet [' &
1277                          // odc_array%odc_flavour%dataType //',' &
1278                          // odc_array%odc_flavour%headOrBody // &
1279                          ']: column index out of range: ', column_index
1280         call odc_abort(message); return
1281      endif
1282
1283   end subroutine odc_columnSet
1284
1285
1286   subroutine odc_deallocate(odc)
1287      !
1288      !:Purpose: Deallocate a single column of obs data
1289      !
1290      !:Arguments:
1291      !           :odc: instance of the obsDataColumn type
1292      !
1293      implicit none
1294      type(struct_obsDataColumn), intent(inout) :: odc
1295
1296      if(.not.odc%allocated) then
1297         call odc_abort('ODC_DEALLOCATE: column is not already allocated.')
1298      endif
1299
1300      odc%allocated=.false.
1301      if(trim(odc%dataType) == 'INT' .and. associated(odc%value_i)) then
1302         deallocate(odc%value_i)
1303         nullify(odc%value_i)
1304         nullify(odc%value_r)    ! Dont deallocate:  this is not the only pointer
1305      end if
1306
1307      if(trim(odc%dataType) == 'REAL' .and. associated(odc%value_r)) then
1308         deallocate(odc%value_r)
1309         nullify(odc%value_r)
1310         nullify(odc%value_i)    ! Dont deallocate:  this is not the only pointer
1311      endif
1312
1313   end subroutine odc_deallocate
1314
1315
1316   function odc_numActiveColumn(odc_array) result(numActiveColumn)
1317      !
1318      !:Purpose: Return the number of active columns that are contained in the given
1319      !           column array.
1320      !
1321      !           The column array can be of any one of the four possible column-array
1322      !           flavours.
1323      !
1324      implicit none
1325      type(struct_obsDataColumn_Array), intent(in) :: odc_array
1326      integer :: numActiveColumn
1327
1328      integer :: column_index
1329
1330      numActiveColumn=0
1331      do column_index = odc_array%odc_flavour%ncol_beg, &
1332                        odc_array%odc_flavour%ncol_end
1333         if(odc_array%odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index))  &
1334            numActiveColumn=numActiveColumn+1
1335      enddo
1336   end function odc_numActiveColumn
1337
1338end module ObsDataColumn_mod
1339
1340
1341module ObsSpaceData_mod
1342  ! MODULE obsSpaceData_mod (prefix='obs' category='6. High-level data objects')
1343  !
1344  !:Purpose: This module contains the definition of the structure named "struct_obs" and
1345  !           methods for accessing its data.  An instance of struct_obs contains
1346  !           all information pertaining to a set of observation-space data.
1347  !
1348  !           This has evolved from the CMA structure, originated in work by
1349  !           D. Vasiljevic at ECMWF.
1350  !
1351  !           |
1352  !
1353  !           Very generally, obsSpaceData can be thought as two tables linked to one another. 
1354  !           
1355  !           A "Header" table:
1356  ! 
1357  !           +-----------------+------+------+------+
1358  !           | headerIndex     | Lat  | Lon  | ...  |
1359  !           +=================+======+======+======+
1360  !           |    1            |      |      |      |
1361  !           +-----------------+------+------+------+
1362  !           |    2            |      |      |      |
1363  !           +-----------------+------+------+------+
1364  !           |    ...          |      |      |      |
1365  !           +-----------------+------+------+------+
1366  !           | n_header        |      |      |      |
1367  !           +-----------------+------+------+------+
1368  !
1369  !           and a "data" table:
1370  ! 
1371  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1372  !           | dataIndex       | Associated headerIndex  | Obs Value   | ...  |
1373  !           +=================+=========================+=============+======+
1374  !           |    1            |            1            |             |      |
1375  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1376  !           |    2            |            1            |             |      |
1377  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1378  !           |    3            |            1            |             |      |
1379  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1380  !           |    4            |            1            |             |      |
1381  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1382  !           |    5            |            2            |             |      |
1383  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1384  !           |    6            |            2            |             |      |
1385  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1386  !           |    7            |            3            |             |      |
1387  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1388  !           |    8            |            3            |             |      |
1389  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1390  !           |    9            |            3            |             |      |
1391  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1392  !           | n_data          |                         |             |      |
1393  !           +-----------------+-------------------------+-------------+------+
1394  !
1395  !           |
1396  !
1397  !           * For satellite observations
1398  !               * One header contains information on lat/lon, azimuth, zenith angle and time. 
1399  !               * Data entries contain: channels, measurement value, etc. 
1400  !
1401  !             .. image:: /_static/satellite.png
1402  !                 :align: center
1403  !
1404  !           |
1405  !
1406  !           * For radar observations
1407  !               * One header for each radar "ray". Contains information on lat/lon of radar, elevation, azimuth, etc. 
1408  !               * Data entries contain: range, altitude, Doppler velocity, etc. 
1409  !
1410  !             .. image:: /_static/radar.png
1411  !                 :align: center
1412  !
1413  !           |
1414  !
1415  !           * For gps radio occultation (GPS-RO)
1416  !               * One header for each profile. Contains information on lat/lon time, etc. 
1417  !               * Data entries contain: bending angle, refractivity, etc.
1418  !
1419  !             .. image:: /_static/gps_ro.png
1420  !                 :align: center
1421  !
1422  !           |
1423  !
1424  !           * For other observations types such as radiosondes and aircrafts, there is one data entry per header rentry. 
1425  !               * headers contain information on lat/lon, time, etc. 
1426  !               * Data entries contain measurement values. 
1427  !
1428  !             .. image:: /_static/others.png
1429  !                 :align: center
1430  !
1431  !
1432  !:What:  The module  "ObsSpaceData_mod" relies on three other modules:
1433  !
1434  !          * ``IndexListDepot_mod``
1435  !          * ``ObsColumnNames_mod``
1436  !          * ``ObsDataColumn_mod``
1437  ! 
1438  !:Note:  Throughout this file:
1439  !
1440  !          * Column_index  is not (in general) indexed from one.  
1441  !          * Each column index has an equivalent name, ``OBS_*`` as defined in ``ObsColumnNames_mod``.
1442  !          * Active_index is indexed from one by definition (a column index).
1443  !          * row_index is indexed from one.  It has no equivalent name.
1444  !          * ``bodyIndex``, etc. is necessarily a row index
1445  !          * ``HeaderIndex``, etc. is necessarily a row index
1446  !
1447  !
1448  !:Schematics:
1449  ! 
1450  !
1451   use codePrecision_mod
1452   use ObsColumnNames_mod
1453   use ObsDataColumn_mod
1454   use IndexListDepot_mod
1455   use mathPhysConstants_mod
1456   implicit none
1457   save
1458   private
1459
1460
1461
1462   ! CLASS-CONSTANT:
1463   ! CLASS-CONSTANT:
1464   ! CLASS-CONSTANT:
1465
1466   logical, save :: obs_class_initialized = .false.
1467
1468   ! end of CLASS-CONSTANT variables.
1469   ! end of CLASS-CONSTANT variables
1470   ! end of CLASS-CONSTANT variables.
1471
1472

1630   ! DERIVED TYPE AND MODULE VARIABLE DECLARATIONS
1631
1632                                        ! It is intended that these null values
1633                                        ! be used with scratchRealHeader, etc.
1634   real(pre_obsReal), parameter :: NULL_COLUMN_VALUE_R = real(-9.99D9, pre_obsReal)
1635   integer          , parameter :: NULL_COLUMN_VALUE_I = -9.99

1637   ! This type is the goal of the ObsSpaceData and supporting modules.  An
1638   ! instance of this derived type contains all information pertaining to a set
1639   ! of observation-space data.
1640   type, public :: struct_obs
1641      private
1642      logical          :: allocated = .false.
1643                                        ! Two internal structures for
1644                                        ! facilitating multiple traversals of
1645                                        ! subsets of the observation-space data.
1646      type(struct_index_list_depot) :: header_index_list_depot
1647      type(struct_index_list_depot) :: body_index_list_depot
1648                                        ! For the cstnid and cfamily arrays:
1649                                        !   1st dim'n:  row index
1650      character(len=12),  pointer :: cstnid(:)
1651      character(len=2),   pointer :: cfamily(:)
1652                                        ! The primary keys for both tables
1653      integer(8), pointer :: headerPrimaryKey(:), bodyPrimaryKey(:)
1654                                        ! The four arrays of data columns
1655      type(struct_obsDataColumn_Array) :: &
1656                             realHeaders, & ! real header columns
1657                             intHeaders,  & ! integer header columns
1658                             realBodies,  & ! real body columns
1659                             intBodies      ! integer body columns
1660
1661      ! These scratch arrays are the basis for allowing the manipulation of both
1662      ! (real and integer) values of any obsDataColumn, without having to decide
1663      ! which one (real or integer) contains the sought value.  This ability
1664      ! simplifies the code.
1665      real(pre_obsReal), pointer :: scratchRealHeader(:), &
1666                                    scratchRealBody  (:)
1667      integer          , pointer :: scratchIntHeader (:), &
1668                                    scratchIntBody   (:)
1669
1670      integer :: numHeader              ! Actual number of headers on record
1671      integer :: numHeader_max          ! maximum number of headers(i.e.stations)
1672      integer :: numBody                ! Actual total number of bodies on record
1673      integer :: numBody_max            ! maximum number of bodies (i.e. data)
1674
1675                                        ! row indices of mpiglobal data, useful
1676                                        ! for transforming from mpiLocal back to
1677                                        ! mpiGlobal
1678                                        !    1st dim'n: row index, only in
1679                                        !               mpiLocal context
1680      integer, pointer, dimension(:) :: headerIndex_mpiglobal  => NULL()
1681      integer, pointer, dimension(:) :: bodyIndex_mpiglobal    => NULL()
1682
1683      logical :: mpi_local       ! T: keep only data needed by this PE (mpilocal)
1684   end type struct_obs
1685

1690   subroutine obs_abort(cdmessage)
1691      !
1692      !:Purpose: To stop a job when an error occurred
1693      !
1694      !:Arguments:
1695      !           :cdmessage: message to be printed
1696      !
1697
1698!#if defined(UNIT_TESTING)
1699!      use pFUnit
1700!#endif
1701      implicit none
1702      character(len=*), intent(in) :: cdmessage
1703
1704      write(*,'(//,4X,"ABORTING IN ObsSpaceData_mod:-------",/,8X,A)')cdmessage
1705      call flush(6)
1706
1707!#if defined(UNIT_TESTING)
1708!      call throw(Exception('exiting in obs_abort'))
1709!#else
1710      call qqexit(13)
1711      stop
1712!#endif
1713   end subroutine obs_abort
1714
1715
1716   subroutine obs_allocate(obsdat, numHeader_max, numBody_max, silent)
1717      !
1718      !:Purpose: Allocate arrays according to the parameters, numHeader_max and
1719      !           numBody_max.  This is a private method.
1720      !
1721      implicit none
1722
1723      type(struct_obs), intent(inout) :: obsdat
1724      integer,          intent(in)    :: numHeader_max
1725      integer,          intent(in)    :: numBody_max
1726      logical, optional,intent(in)    :: silent
1727
1728      logical :: silent_
1729      integer :: column_index
1730
1731      if(obsdat%allocated) then
1732         call obs_abort('OBS_ALLOCATE:  a second allocation of ObsSpaceData has been attempted.')
1733         return
1734      endif
1735      obsdat%allocated=.true.
1736
1737      if(present(silent)) then
1738         silent_  = silent
1739      else
1740         silent_  = .false.
1741      end if
1742
1743      if(.not. silent_) then
1744         write(*,*) ' DIMENSIONS OF OBSERVATION ARRAYS:'
1745         write(*,*) ' numHeader_max = ',numHeader_max,'  numBody_max = ', &
1746                    numBody_max
1747      end if
1748      obsdat%numHeader_max=numHeader_max
1749      obsdat%numBody_max=numBody_max
1750
1751      !
1752      ! ALLOCATE THE ARRAYS and initialize the contents
1753      !
1754      allocate(obsdat%realHeaders%columns(NHDR_REAL_BEG:NHDR_REAL_END))
1755      obsdat%realHeaders%odc_flavour => odc_flavour_RH
1756
1757      allocate(obsdat%intHeaders%columns(NHDR_INT_BEG:NHDR_INT_END))
1758      obsdat%intHeaders%odc_flavour => odc_flavour_IH
1759
1760      HEADER:if(numHeader_max > 0) then
1761         allocate(obsdat%headerPrimaryKey(numHeader_max))
1762         obsdat%headerPrimaryKey(:) = 0
1763
1764         allocate(obsdat%cfamily(numHeader_max))
1765         obsdat%cfamily(:)='XX'
1766
1767         allocate(obsdat%cstnid(numHeader_max))
1768         obsdat%cstnid(:)='XXXXXXXXXXXX'
1769
1770         allocate(obsdat%scratchRealHeader(numHeader_max))
1771         allocate(obsdat%scratchIntHeader (numHeader_max))
1772         obsdat%scratchRealHeader(:) = NULL_COLUMN_VALUE_R
1773         obsdat%scratchIntHeader (:) = NULL_COLUMN_VALUE_I
1774
1775         do column_index=NHDR_REAL_BEG,NHDR_REAL_END
1776            if(obsdat%realHeaders%odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index))  &
1777               call odc_allocate(obsdat%realHeaders%columns(column_index), &
1778                                 numHeader_max, &
1779                                 ocn_ColumnNameList_RH(column_index),'REAL',&
1780                                 obsdat%scratchRealHeader, &
1781                                 obsdat%scratchIntHeader)
1782         enddo
1783
1784         do column_index=NHDR_INT_BEG,NHDR_INT_END
1785            if(obsdat%intHeaders%odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index))  &
1786               call odc_allocate(obsdat%intHeaders%columns(column_index), &
1787                                 numHeader_max, &
1788                                 ocn_ColumnNameList_IH(column_index),'INT ', &
1789                                 obsdat%scratchRealHeader, &
1790                                 obsdat%scratchIntHeader)
1791         enddo
1792      endif HEADER
1793
1794      allocate(obsdat%realBodies%columns(NBDY_REAL_BEG:NBDY_REAL_END))
1795      obsdat%realBodies%odc_flavour => odc_flavour_RB
1796
1797      allocate(obsdat%intBodies%columns(NBDY_INT_BEG:NBDY_INT_END))
1798      obsdat%intBodies%odc_flavour => odc_flavour_IB
1799
1800      BODY:if(numBody_max > 0) then
1801         allocate(obsdat%bodyPrimaryKey(numBody_max))
1802         obsdat%bodyPrimaryKey(:)   = 0
1803
1804         allocate(obsdat%scratchRealBody(numBody_max))
1805         allocate(obsdat%scratchIntBody (numBody_max))
1806         obsdat%scratchRealBody(:) = NULL_COLUMN_VALUE_R
1807         obsdat%scratchIntBody (:) = NULL_COLUMN_VALUE_I
1808
1809         do column_index=NBDY_REAL_BEG,NBDY_REAL_END
1810            if(obsdat%realBodies%odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index))  &
1811               call odc_allocate(obsdat%realBodies%columns(column_index), &
1812                                 numBody_max, &
1813                                 ocn_ColumnNameList_RB(column_index),'REAL', &
1814                                 obsdat%scratchRealBody, obsdat%scratchIntBody)
1815         enddo
1816
1817         do column_index=NBDY_INT_BEG,NBDY_INT_END
1818            if(obsdat%intBodies%odc_flavour%columnActive(column_index))  &
1819               call odc_allocate(obsdat%intBodies%columns(column_index), &
1820                                 numBody_max, &
1821                                 ocn_ColumnNameList_IB(column_index),'INT ', &
1822                                 obsdat%scratchRealBody, obsdat%scratchIntBody)
1823         enddo
1824      endif BODY
1825
1826      call ild_initialize(obsdat%header_index_list_depot, obsdat%numHeader_max)
1827      call ild_initialize(obsdat%body_index_list_depot,   obsdat%numBody_max)
1828   end subroutine obs_allocate
1829
